Instruction: Roll out pie dough and place it in a 9-inch pie pan.

Heat oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat; sautï¿½ onion until it becomes lightly browned, about 5 to 10 minutes. Then, add ground beef; cook and stir until the beef is thoroughly browned and crumbly, approximately 5 to 10 minutes. Incorporate pinto beans and black beans into the beef mixture.
Sprinkle the Mexican cheese blend over the beef and bean mixture; stir to combine. Add the diced tomatoes along with the green chile peppers into the beef-bean mixture.
Combine corn bread mix, milk, and eggs in a bowl until the batter is smooth. Spread the batter over the beef-bean mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cornbread comes out clean, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Bake the pie in a 2-quart or 9x13-inch baking dish if a cast-iron skillet is unavailable.
